She lives with her parents, her partner and her 3 children who are 6, 14 and 10 years old. They live in their own home. Mariela’s business is selling ladies', men’s and children’s clothing of the most diverse models and styles. All this clothing is sent to her by her sister who lives in the city of Lima, searching for the latest fashion so that later Mariela can sell it from her home to her neighbors, friends and acquaintances. In addition she goes out and sells them in other areas of the city. Her sales are made on credit or for cash, and she has made herself known in the 10 years that she has had this business.
She likes her business since she feels independent having her own income to support her partner in the household expenses as well as because of the free time she has to be able to raise her children. On the contrary, she mentions that it is uncomfortable when some of her customers get behind on their payments, but this does not stop her from fulfilling her commitments. Now, she has plans to grow her business more. This will be her second loan with the MFP institution, so she hopes for their collaboration in other to continue with her objectives. Additionally, she feels comfortable with the communal bank since she likes the work they do supporting people. With the 800 new Peruvian soles requested, she will invest in merchandise for sale, like clothing. She will send the money to her sister who will make the purchases for her searching for the lowest prices in order to have the greatest profit.

loans.use: to buy more clothing.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
As a married mother of eleven children, Juanita works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling firewood and charcoal. Juanita is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell for her general store business.

Juanita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a basket weaving business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy frames and other materials for her basket weaving business.

Flora has been in this business for 2 years. Flora earns additional income from hog raising.

Flora has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand the business in the future.

loans.use: to buy frames and other materials for basket weaving

loans.name: Mwachi

texts.en:
Mwachi is a 50-year-old fish monger in Likoni, Mombasa. He is married. He has been selling fish for the past 20 years successfully.

This marks his first business loan from KADET to finance his business. He plans to buy more fish to sell to his customers. He will use the anticipated profits for further expansion of his business. He hopes to have a bigger, more profitable business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish for selling

loans.name: Ma.glenda

texts.en:
Ma.Glenda is 34 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma.Glenda is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy feed, medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Ma.Glenda has been raising pigs for 3 years and also earns additional income from a vulcanizing shop.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicines and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Teofilo Ananias

texts.es:
En el sitio Santa Martha de la  parroquia Riochico en Portoviejo,  cada quince días se  reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Querer Es Poder De Riochico. Este lugar se lo conoce por su  vegetación donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura.

Aquí conocimos al señor Teófilo, tiene 18 años  de edad, está soltero y vive en casa de sus padres, este año termino sus estudios secundarios y espera continuar sus estudios superiores. Lleva dos ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ha podido empezar su negocio.

Él es un joven muy trabajador y responsable que utilizo el primer crédito para empezar un negocio de compra y venta de miel de abeja, en la finca de su papá tiene algunos panales de abejas y junto  su padre le dan el mantenimiento adecuado y la extracción de la miel cada cierto tiempo, la misma que él sale a vender a la ciudad de Portoviejo y Manta lugar donde vende muy bien sus productos y donde tiene clientes que a menudo le dejan sus productos, el también compra este producto a los vecinos que se dedican al cultivo y extracción de la miel.

Este crédito es para comprar miel de abeja para la venta diaria.

Sus sueños son seguir sus estudios y ser un buen profesional.
texts.en:
At the St. Martha place located in the Riochico Portoviejo, every fifteen days the members of the community bank “to want is to be able to” from Riochico.  This place is known for its vegetation where most of the inhabitants work in agriculture. 

Here is where we met Teofilo, 18, single, lives with his parents, finished high school this year and hopes to continue with post-secondary school.  He has gone through two cycles at the community bank and likes it because thanks to the loans he was able to start his business.

He is a hardworking young man and a responsible one that used his first loan to start a business of buying and selling honey, at his father's ranch there are some honeycombs that he and his dad  take care off and extract honey from every so often, same honey that he goes to sell to the city of Portoviejo and Manta place where he sells his products very well and has clients to whom he delivers products often, he also buys honey from neighbours who are also honey farmers.

This loan is to buy honey for sale.

His dreams are to continue studying and become a professional.

loans.use: To buy honey.

loans.name: Miriam Karina

texts.es:
La Señora. Miriam es socia del banco comunal El Reencuentro, vive por un sector de la parroquia de Baños en Cuenca, Baños se sitúa al pie de la Cordillera Occidental, en un sitio de irregular relieve. Esta parroquia moviliza grandes cantidades de gente, atraídos por las bondades de sus aguas termales, la majestuosidad de su templo y la fiesta de la Virgen de Guadalupe. Su gente es amable y gentil, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, dedicándose al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura.

Doña Miriam tiene 24 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijas de 8, 4 y 3 años de edad, sus dos primeras hijas están estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de un familiar.

La Señora Miriam se dedica al cuidado de sus hijas pasando la mayor parte de su tiempo en casa, en sus tiempos libres se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo, actividad que la realiza hace un año.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su suegra. Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa para aumentar su mercadería.
 
Su meta es tener una boutique para tener un negocio más estable.
texts.en:
Miriam is a member of the El Reencuentro Communal Bank.  She lives in an area of the parish of Baños in Cuenca.  Baños is located at the foot of the western range of the Andes on a site of irregular relief.  Large numbers of people move through this parish attracted by the benefits of its hot springs, the majesty of its temple, and the festival of the Virgin of Guadalupe.  Its people are pleasant and kind and they maintain the culture and traditions of their ancestors.  The work in commerce, animal rearing, and agriculture.

Miriam is 24 years old, married, and has three daughters who are eight, four, and three years old.  Her first two daughters attend a small school in the city.  Her husband works as a private employee.  They don't own their own home, so they live in a relative's house.

Miriam spends most of her time at home taking care of her children.  In her free time she sells clothing through catalogs, which she's been doing for a year now.

This is the first loan she is taking out with the communal bank, which she was invited to join by her mother-in-law.  She will use the loan to buy clothing to add to her merchandise.

Her goal is to have a boutique to have a more stable business.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is a 38-year-old retail shop proprietor in Mariakani. He is a married father of four. He has been running his shop for the past four years. 

This is his second business loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to purchase more rice, maize flour, baking flour, and washing detergents. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children and improve his clothes-selling business. He hopes to have a well established business.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, maize flour, baking flour, and washing detergents

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 48 years old and married to Elizabeth, a primary school teacher. They are blessed with three children, ages 14, 10 and 8. Moses is a dairy  farmer and has been supplying milk for 10 years. He earns a monthly income of 30,000 KES.

Moses has joined KADET LTD through a self-help group and is now servicing a loan of 20,000 KES. This is his first loan, and he wishes to use the money to purchase dairy feeds for the animals and to improve the dairy structures on the farm. The profits will be used to plough back into the farm.

He hopes to purchase a plot and develop residential houses and also educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase dairy feeds and improve the structures on the farm

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 39 years old, married, and the father of two children. For the last two years, he has earned a living by selling goods from his retail shop. He earns a monthly profit of 20,000 KES. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officers. He is applying for his first loan, 50,000 KES, to buy additional inventory such as baking flour, soft drinks, cooking oil, and so on to sell to his customers. 

He will use the anticipated profits to pay his children's school fees. His goal for the future is to continue growing his business so that he can give his family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory such as baking flour, soft drinks, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria, de 43 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa. Está casada con Víctor quien en agricultor, vive en compañía de sus 02 hijos y sus 02 nietos a los que quiere mucho, habitando en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Victoria es la agricultura, específicamente en la siembra de palma aceitera. Para eso cuenta con un terreno de 5 hectáreas de extensión ubicado en un caserío, donde es muy  conocida, logrando obtener una producción de la totalidad de su terreno. Lleva más de 09 años realizando esa actividad, contando con el apoyo de peones o algún contratista para que lo ayuden en la cosecha. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite contar con un ingreso permanente para solventar los gastos de su hogar así como contar con un oficio. Además de las buena rentabilidad que tiene ese negocio pues su producción es constante y los compradores también. Ahora tiene planes de ampliar las extensiones de su siembra para así tener mayores ingresos. Este será el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Además de estar contenta con su banco comunal pues lo considera un grupo unido. Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes, así como contratar peones para la cosecha.
texts.en: Forty-three-year-old Victoria is a hardworking and dedicated woman.  She is married to Victor, who is a farmer.  She lives in her own home with her two children and her two grandchildren, whom she loves very much.  Victoria works in agriculture for a living, specifically in the growing of palm for oil.  She has a 5-ha. plot of land for growing located in a small village where she is very well known.  She is able to produce on all of her land.  She has been in this business for nine years with the help of workers or a contractor to help her with her harvest.  She likes this business because it gives her a permanent source of income to cover her household expenses and because it has given her a trade.  This business also has good profitability because the production is consistent and the buyers are too.  She currently has plans to extend her growing area to make more income.  This will be her second loan with MFP and she counts on their collaboration to continue toward her goals.  She is also happy with her communal bank because it is a close-knit group.  She will use the requested 800 nuevos soles to buy fertilizers and to hire workers for the harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and hire workers

loans.name: Linus

texts.en:
Linus is thirty-two years old. He is married to Lucy and they have one daughter who is five years old.

Linus is a farmer and has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him to buy pesticides and upgrade the shed that shelters his animals.

He hopes to have many livestock in the future.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and upgrade his animal shed.

loans.name: Gerard

texts.en:
Gerald is thirty-five years old, married, and with three children. Gerald is a mechanic in the area of Githurai. He has been in this business for the last thirteen years and gets an income of KES 30,000 per month.

He has got good credit history in KADET and is applying for his second loan of KES 80,000 from KADET Ltd. which he plans to use to buy spares and oil machines. 

He will use the anticipated profit to educate his children and expand his garage. He hopes to expand his garage to a big one and educate his children

loans.use: To buy spares for his garage.

loans.name: Sara Patricia

texts.es:
La Señora Sara es socia del banco comunal El Reencuentro, vive por un sector de la parroquia de Baños en Cuenca, Baños se sitúa al pie de la Cordillera Occidental, en un sitio de irregular relieve. Esta parroquia moviliza grandes cantidades de gente, atraídos por las bondades de sus aguas termales, la majestuosidad de su templo y la fiesta de la Virgen de Guadalupe. Su gente es amable y gentil, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, dedicándose al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura.

La Señora. Sara tiene 22 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido un niño  de 3 años de edad. Su esposo es comerciante y la casa en la que vive es arrendada.

Doña Sara tiene un taller de confección desde muy joven, fabrica y comercializa pantalones jeans, en el trabaja hace 6 años de lunes a sábados sin un horario fijo.

Se encuentra en el segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en su negocio en la compra de materia prima como: tela, hilos, cierres, botones, etc. 

Su meta es tener un almacén para vender la ropa que fabrica.
texts.en:
Sara is a member of the El Reencuentro Communal Bank.  She lives in an area of the parish of Baños in Cuenca.  Baños is located at the foot of the western range of the Andes on a site of irregular relief.  Large numbers of people move through this parish attracted by the benefits of its hot springs, the majesty of its temple, and the festival of the Virgin of Guadalupe.  Its people are pleasant and kind and they maintain the cultures and traditions of their ancestors.  The work in commerce, animal rearing, and agriculture for a living.

Sara is 22 years old, married, and has a three-year-old son.  Her husband is a storekeeper and the house they live in is rented.

Sara has had a sewing workshop since she was very young where she makes and sells jeans.  She has been doing this work for six years from Monday to Saturday without a set schedule.

This is the second loan she is taking out with the communal bank and she's going to invest it in her business by buying raw material such as fabric, thread, zippers, buttons, etc.

Her goal is to have a shop to sell the clothes she makes.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, zippers, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is aged twenty-nine and has been in active farming for seven years in his hometown of Kitale in Western Kenya. His farm produces milk, maize, beans and vegetables for the local market. He is married with four children aged between eleven and three. 

Isaac has requested a loan of 100,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help him venture into poultry farming. He says he will use the money to build a poultry housing unit at 60,000 KES and the rest to buy poultry birds. He adds he has gathered a lot of information on the challenges in the business and is assured of the availability of the market for his products. He says the income will help him meet family needs and more specifically educate his children.
He says poultry diseases pose the greatest challenge for the business

loans.use: To construct a poultry housing unit and buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Ann is thirty-three years old, single, with one child. Ann sells vegetables like cabbages and fruits like bananas. She has been in this business for the last  two years and gets an income of KES 17,800 per month.

Ann has got good credit history in KADET and she is applying for her second loan of KES 50,000 from KADET Ltd.  which she plans to use to buy more cabbages, potatoes and bananas for sale. 

She will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees. She hopes to buy a lorry for transporting supplies.

loans.use: To buy cabbages and potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a twenty-nine year old man from Kapune area of Kilgoris town. He is married to Catherine and they have three children aged between seven months and six years.

Daniel runs a food kiosk, a business he has done for the last seven years. He makes a monthly income of KES 13,000. He is taking his second loan from KADET Ltd. which he will use to buy food stuff for his kiosk. His profits will be used to diversify into farming.

His dream is to have a well-stocked business.

loans.use: To buy foodstuff for his kiosk.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is forty-two years old, a retail shop proprietor in Marikani. He is a divorced father of five. He has been running his shop for the past four years successfully. 

This marks his second business loan from KADET Ltd. to finance his business. With the loan, he plans to purchase more rice, cooking fats, maize flour and washing detergents. 

He will use the anticipated profits to repay his loan and educate his children. He hopes to have well established business.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, cooking fats, maize flour and washing detergents.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson is thirty-three years old. He owns a general store in Shanzu, Mombasa, and is married. He has been running this business for the past three years with great success.

This marks Johnson’s third business loan from KADET Ltd. He plans to purchase more car tires, bicycle tires and break fluid. 

He will use the anticipated profits to repay his loan and to expand his business further. He hopes to buy a personal car.

loans.use: to purchase more car tires, bicycle tires and break fluid.

loans.name: Erika Yesenia

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal La Unidas Somos Más. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar vive la señora Erika, tiene 30 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de tres años de edad. El marido es comerciante.
 
Ella es una gran mujer que realiza el crédito para que su esposo lo utilice  en su negocio, él se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres para lo cual los fines de semana instala un pequeño puesto en el mercado, también realiza dos a tres viajes por semana hasta la cuidad de Quito llevando todo tipo de frutas de la costa como sandias, melones, zapallo, naranjas, entre otras muchas frutas que se venden a muy buen precio en esta ciudad, allá entrega a comerciantes al por mayor, allí mismo también aprovecha para traer mercadería que vende los fines de semana. Lleva más de 6 años dedicado a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar todo tipo de frutas de la costa. Está en el Banco Comunal hace dos ciclos, es la secretaria del grupo  y le gusta porque ha hecho muchas amigas en el grupo. 

Su meta es comprar un carro ya que en el que realizan sus viajes es fletado, con el cual se va una gran parte de las ganancias.
texts.en:
The members of the La Unidas Somos Más Communal Bank meet in the canton of Rocafuerte every fifteen days.  This place is known for its delicious candies, which are made by the locals and are known throughout the whole country.

This is where Erika lives.  She is 30 years old and she has a domestic partnership and a three-year-old son.  Her partner is a storekeeper.

She is a great woman who is taking out this loan for her partner to use in his business.  He sells fruits and vegetables for a living from a small stall he sets up on the weekends at the market.  He also makes two or three trips per week to the city of Quito where he takes all kinds of fruits from the coast, such as watermelons, melons, pumpkins, and oranges, among many other fruits that sell for very good prices in the city.  He makes deliveries to wholesale dealers there and he also takes advantage by bringing back merchandise that he sells on the weekends.  He has been in this business for six years and it's going very well for him.
 
She will use this loan to buy all kinds of fruits from the coast.  She has been with the communal bank for two loan cycles; she is the group's secretary; and she likes it because she has made many friends in the group.

Her goal is to buy a car because the one he uses for his trips is rented, which takes a large part of his earnings.

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Ilusha

texts.en:
Ilusha is from the village of Kotelia, South Georgia. He is fifty-nine years old and lives with his wife Aghunik. The only source of income for the family is agriculture. They have two milk cows. Aghunik and Ilusha make cheese and sell it locally. Also the family owns five hectares of land, which is used for growing potatoes, barley and wheat. Harvested products are sold locally to retailers. The total average monthly income of the family is 150 Laris.

Ilusha requested credit to purchase additional land, which is being sold by the local government. They will be able to cultivate more land and harvest more products, which will be sold. Their income will increase and the family will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural land.

loans.name: Noah

texts.en:
Noah is a farmer in Litein South Rift, Kenya. He is aged thirty-five and married with four children aged between eight and two. He has been in farming for 10 years and currently sells his produce of milk and tea to the local market. He gets additional income from a local tea factory where he works as a casual laborer.

Noah has requested a loan of  50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy an additional dairy cow for his dairy business. He says he wants to add another dairy cow to enable him enjoy economies of scale. He adds he will use the income to expand his farming business and improve his family's living standards.

He says unreliable rainfall and unstable market prices are the greatest challenges to farmers in the area.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is fifty years old. He is married with nine children. He operates a posho mill, and also sells dry maize to his customers. He gets a monthly income of KES 20,000. He has been in the business for the past twenty-one years.

This is his first loan term with KADET Ltd. He will use the loan amount to purchase cereals to mill and sell as flour. 

He hopes to expand his business by opening another mill and also opening a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase cereals to mill and sell as flour.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama  is a fishmonger who also sells rice and gari at Ampanyi near Elmina. She buys fresh fish from the market, smokes it and then sells it.  She has been in this business for some years now. Ama is married to a fisherman and has three children. Ama assists her husband to feed and cloth their children. 

Ama will use her loan to purchase more fish which she will smoke and sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish which she will smoke and sell.

loans.name: Liliana Beatriz

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal La Unidas Somos Más. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar vive la señora Liliana, tiene 25 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 7 y 2 años de edad, el mayor estudia en escuela. El marido trabaja en una camaronera. Ella estudio belleza en una academia de la localidad hace varios años.

La señora Liliana es una joven ama de casa que además de estará al tanto de su hogar también realiza todo tipo de trabajos de belleza que aprendió en la academia, los realiza en su casa y a domicilio, ella pinta uñas, hace tinturados y cortes de cabello entre otras cosas, poco a poco está comprando las herramientas necesarias para instalar su salón de belleza. Ella lleva más de 3 años dedicada a esta actividad y le va bastante bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar ciertas herramientas y materiales para su trabajo como: tintes, shampoo, fijador, esmaltes, tijeras, etc. Está en el Banco Comunal hace tres ciclos, es la presidenta del grupo  y le gusta porque el grupo es muy unido.
 
Su meta son tener un gran salón de belleza.
texts.en:
The La Unidas Somos Mas community bank meets twice a month in the Ecuadorean canton of Rocafuerte.  Rocafuerte is known for a traditional sweet that is famous around the country.

Our member, Liliana, is 25 years old.  She is partnered and has two children, 7- and 2-years old, respectively, the oldest of whom is in school.  Liliana's partner is a truck driver.  She is a busy young woman with all of the responsibility that goes with running a household.  Even so, she has opened her own salon, applying the skills that she learned at a local beauty school several years ago.   

Liliana operates the business in a room of her house.  Among other services, she cuts and dyes hair and paints nails.  She is slowly buying the tools that she needs to operate the business.  She started the salon 3 years ago and tells us that she is happy with her progress.  

Liliana will use this loan to buy the supplies--dyes, shampoos, hairspray, nail varnish, etc.--she needs to run her business.  This is the banks' third round of funding.  Liliana is the president of the group and says that its members are supportive of one another.  

Her goal is to open a larger salon.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Huber Adrian

texts.es:
Huber es una persona que se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajadora y siempre querer generar sus propios ingresos, es por esto que desde muy temprana edad empezó a trabajar con su padre en la carpintería que este tenía, y posteriormente pasó a manejarla directamente. Actualmente Huber se encuentra casado y es padre de una hija de 2 años a quienes siempre les ha querido brindar una buena calidad de vida. Huber es reconocido gracias a que tanto su padre como el, siempre han ofrecido trabajos de muy buena calidad, y gracias a esto Huber tiene una gran cantidad de clientes que le hacen muy buenos pedidos. Actualmente Huber tiene un pedido de un cliente suyo muy numeroso, por lo que requiere comprar materia prima para poderlo elaborar, sin embargo, Huber no cuenta con mucho dinero disponible, por lo que tiene la esperanza en que un préstamo le brindará la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de materiales como madera, pegante, clavos, entre otros para la elaboración de un pedido que le ha hecho un cliente.

Huber espera que de esta manera pueda seguir generando los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su familia y poder mejorarle la calidad de vida. Además, sueña con que su familia pueda gozar de mejores capacidades económicas y su hija en un futuro pueda ingresar a una educación de buena calidad.
texts.en:
Huber is a very hard-working person, and he has always wanted to generate his own income.  That is why, at a very young age, he started working with his father in the carpentry shop that he had.  He later managed it personally.

Huber is now married and has a two year old daughter.  He has always wanted to give them a good quality of life.  Huber is known, thanks to his father as much as himself, for always offering very good quality work.  Thanks to this Huber has a lot of customers who place very good orders with him.

Huber currently has a very large order from one of his customers.  He needs to buy to raw material to be able to manufacture it.  However, Huber does not have much available money.  That is why he has the hope that a loan will give him to opportunity to buy materials like wood, glue, and nails, among others in order to produce the order his customer has made.

Huber hopes that this way he will be able to continue generating the needed income to support his family and to be able to improve their quality of life.  Also, he dreams that his family will be able to enjoy improved financial means.  He dreams that in the future his daughter will be able to have a good quality education.

loans.use: to buy materials like wood, glue, and nails, among others in order to produce the order his customer has made.

loans.name: Silvana

texts.es:
Emprendedora es la mejor palabra con la que se puede caracterizar a Silvana; una joven de 19 años que acabó de terminar un curso técnico de contabilidad y finanzas y ahora, gracias a la gente que conoció en este, quiere montar un negocio de venta de mercancía como ropa y joyas con el ánimo de generar sus ingresos. Silvana proviene de una vereda cercana a su municipio, pero se mudó hacia el municipio de Yarumal con el ánimo de buscar mejores oportunidades de progreso. En este municipio vive con su hermano y desde allí ha empezado a proyectar su futuro. Silvana quiere montar este negocio porque la gente que conoció en el curso la animó para que vendiera mercancía, el principal argumento era que allí tendría una gran cantidad de clientes para atender.

Debido a que Silvana no cuenta con un gran capital para poder comprar la mercancía que ofrecerá a sus clientes, Silvana busca un préstamo que le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de mercancía de ropa y joyas con el ánimo de poder empezar su negocio.

Silvana espera que de esta manera su negocio se ponga en marcha y pueda así generar sus propios ingresos y colaborar con su hermano en el sostenimiento del hogar. Además, espera poder contribuirle a sus padres con una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas. Silvana sueña con tener un gran negocio, con continuar estudiando y ser una gran profesional y en un futuro forjar una familia.
texts.en:
"Enterprising" is the best word to describe Silvana, a 19-year-old young lady who just finished a technical course in accounting and finance and who now, thanks to the people she met in that course, wants to set up a business selling merchandise such as clothing and jewelry in order to make money.  Silvana is from an area nearby her municipality, but she moved to the municipality of Yarumal to seek out better opportunities for progress.  She lives with her brother in this municipality and it's where she has started to plan her future.  Silvana wants to set up this business because the people she met in her course motivated her to sell merchandise.  Their main argument was that she would have a large number of customers to serve there.

Because Silvana doesn't have a lot of capital to buy the merchandise she will offer her customers, she's looking for a loan that will give her the opportunity to obtain clothing and jewelry merchandise in order to start her business.

Silvana hopes that this will get her business started and that she will be able to make her own income and work with her brother maintain their home.  She also hopes to be able to contribute to giving her parents a better quality of life and better financial opportunities.  Silvana dreams of having a large business, continuing her studies, being a successful professional, and, in the future, starting a family.

loans.use: to buy clothing and jewelry merchandise to start her business

loans.name: Sofia Aurora

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal La Unidas Somos Más. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar vive la señora Sofía, tiene 30 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 10 y 8  años y un bebé de 7 meses de edad. El marido es comerciante.
 
Ella junto a su esposo se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres, dos veces por semana se desplazan hasta la ciudad de La Latacunga, en esta ciudad entregan sus productos a comerciantes tanto al por mayor como al menudeo, ellos llevan todo  tipo de frutas de la costa como: sandias, melones, papayas, naranjas, además de legumbres como: habas, habichuelas, tomates, entre otros productos que se venden a muy buen precio en esta ciudad. Llevan más de 2 años que se dedican a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
p>
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar verduras, tomates, melones, piñas, entre otras frutas. Está en el Banco Comunal hace tres ciclos y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado mucho. 

Su meta es comprar un carro para realizar sus viajes.

En la foto está la socia con su bebé.
texts.en:
The La Unidas Somos Mas community bank meets twice a month in the Ecuadorean canton of Rocafuerte.  Rocafuerte is known for a traditional sweet that is famous around the country.

Our member, Sofia, is 30 years old.  She is partnered and has three children: 10-years, 8-years and 7-months old, respectively.  Sofia's partner is a merchant and they operate a produce sales business together.  

Sofia and her partner travel to the city of La Latacunga twice a week to sell their produce there.  They take all kinds of fruits--watermelons, honeydew melons, papayas, oranges--and vegetables--broad beans, green beans, tomatoes--to sell.  Their customers include both everyday buyers and wholesalers.  Sofia says that they have operated the business for 2 years and are happy with their progress.  

Sofia will use this loan to buy fruits and vegetables for her produce business.  This is the bank's third round of funding and Sofia says that the loans she's received have helped her a lot.

Her goal for the future is to buy a "carro" for moving her produce to market.

You can see Sofia in the photo with her baby.

loans.use: to buy merchandise that she will resell.

loans.name: Juan Del Mar

texts.es:
Juan se ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al mantenimiento y reparación de motocicletas. Aprendió la actividad empíricamente, gracias a que desde muy temprana edad empezó a trabajar en talleres de reparación donde iba aprendiendo. Desde hace 2 años decidió independizarse y montar en su casa un taller de mantenimiento y reparación de motocicletas. Gracias a esto, Juan genera los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar, donde convive solo con su hijo de 16 años, pues su madre se separó de ellos hace un tiempo. Juan es reconocido en la región por la buena calidad de sus servicios, y gracias a esto su negocio ha ido creciendo poco a poco. 

Debido a que tiene gran volumen de trabajo, Juan requiere de la compra de algunos repuestos para las motocicletas, por lo que tiene la esperanza en que un préstamo le brindará la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de repuestos para motocicleta como son bujías, empaquetadoras, bandas para frenos, bombillería, etc.

Juan espera que de esta manera pueda continuar ejerciendo su trabajo y sus clientes sigan quedando satisfechos con sus servicios. Además, espera que sus ingresos le permitan brindarle a su hijo una mejor educación y una mejor calidad de vida. Juan sueña con tener un gran taller el cual pueda generar empleo y sea reconocido en su región, y con el cual le pueda brindar a su hijo una estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Juan has worked for a great part of his life maintaining and repairing motorcycles. He learned this trade by working in it, thanks to the fact that at a very early age, he began to work in repair shops where he gradually learned. Two years ago he decided to become independent and set up a motorcycle maintenance and repair shop in his home. Thanks to this, Juan generates the necessary income to sustain his household, where he lives with just his 16-year-old son, since his mother separated from them some time ago. Juan is known in his region for the good quality of his services, and thanks to this, his business has been growing little by little.

Because he has a large volume of work, Juan needs to buy some spare parts for the motorcycles. For this reason he hopes that the loan will offer him the opportunity to purchase spare parts for motorcycles such as spark plugs, gaskets, brake pads, headlights, etc.

Juan hopes that in this way he can continue practicing his trade and his customers will continue to be satisfied with his services. In addition, he hopes that his income will allow him to offer his son a good education and a better quality of life. Juan dreams of having a large shop where he could generate employment and be known in his region, and with which he could offer his son an economically stable life.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for motorcycles, such as spark plugs, gaskets, brake pads, headlights, etc.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es:
Samuel gran parte de su vida se ha dedicado a la actividad de la panadería. Desde muy joven comenzó a trabajar en una panadería de su municipio natal y allí aprendió la actividad. Posteriormente fue trasladado para la ciudad de Medellín y allí conoció a su esposa. Actualmente Samuel se ha independizado y gracias a un programa de cooperación que le colaboró con la obtención de algunos bienes, Samuel montó su propia panadería. Actualmente el negocio no es muy grande pero sus clientes reconocen que sus productos son de muy buena calidad. Gracias a que su negocio ha ido creciendo poco a poco, y sus clientes cada vez le hace pedidos más grandes, Samuel requiere adecuar su lugar de trabajo de modo que le pueda permitir elaborar sus productos con mayor eficiencia. Debido a que Samuel no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar estas adecuaciones locativas, tiene la esperanza en que un préstamo le brindará la posibilidad de acceder a realizar mejoras locativas a su sitio de trabajo con el ánimo de poder elaborar sus productos en un sitio adecuado para esto con todas las normas sanitarias.

Samuel espera que de esta manera pueda atender clientes que antes debía rechazar, pues le exigían algunos requisitos de sanidad que el no podía cumplir. Samuel sueña con que su negocio se convierta en una gran panadería en la cual pueda atender a una gran cantidad de clientes, además, sueña con poder generar empleo para las personas que más lo necesitan y brindarles a su esposa y su hijo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Samuel has dedicated a large part of his life to his bakery business.  Since he was very young, be began to work in a bakery in the town where he was born and that's where he learned this business.  He later moved to the city of Medellin, which is where he met his wife.  Currently, Samuel has become independent and, thanks to a cooperative program that was able to secure him some money, he set up his own bakery.  His business isn't very large at the moment, but his customers know that his products are of very good quality.  Because his business has been growing little by little and his customers are making bigger orders every time, Samuel needs to change his workplace to that he can make his products more efficiently.  As Samuel doesn't have enough capital to make these changes to his business, he hopes that a loan will enable him to make improvements on his workspace in order to make his products in a suitable environment that meets all the sanitary requirements.

Samuel hopes that this will allow him to serve customers he had to turn away before because they demanded certain sanitary requirements that he couldn't meet.  Samuel dreams of turning his business into a huge bakery where he can serve a large amount of customers.  He also dreams of being able to employ people who really need work and of offering his wife and child a better quality of life.

loans.use: to make improvements on his workspace in order to make his products in a suitable environment that meets all the sanitary requirements

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba is the woman pounding fufu (dough). She operates a chop bar where a variety of African dishes are sold; this she has done for two years. The food she serves are fufu, banku (fermented dough often served with fish) and rice balls. She is married with five children. Araba uses her income to support her husband in paying their children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase foodstuffs and other ingredients to prepare the dishes for sale. With the new profit, Araba plans to operate a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs and other ingredients to prepare the dishes for sale.

loans.name: Miryam

texts.es: Miryam es una persona muy trabajadora y dedicada a su familia. Desde hace 5 años aproximadamente, Miryam tomó el trabajo de la tienda general, que anteriormente era trabajado por su hermano y este falleció, desde entonces Miryam es la que debe responder por el sostenimiento de su madre que es mayor de edad y por esto atiende su tienda con el ánimo de generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su madre y para aportar en a su esposo con los ingresos de su hogar. Miryam es casada y tiene un hijo de 2 años, a los cuales siempre les ha querido brindar lo mejor posible. Miryam busca que su madre pueda tener un buen bienestar y que su hijo y su esposo puedan tener mayores oportunidades. La tienda general en la cual Miryam trabaja tiene la ventaja de que no tiene que pagar arriendo, pues el local donde funciona es propiedad de su madre. Sin embargo, por la falta de capital si ha visto como su negocio se ha ido viendo con poca mercancía, por lo que actualmente requiere surtir el negocio; es por esto que Miryam tiene la esperanza en que un préstamo le brindará la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de productos de la canasta familiar y poder tener un mayor surtido de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes. Miryam espera que con este préstamo sus ventas aumenten considerablemente, pues podrá atender más necesidades de sus clientes. Miryam sueña con poder tener un gran negocio que le genere grandes ingresos y en el cual pueda generar empleo. Además, Miryam sueña con que su madre pueda gozar de un mejor bienestar y que su esposo y su hijo puedan obtener una estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Miryam is working hard to support her family.  She has operated a corner grocery store for about 5 years.  Her brother started the business and she worked for him there, only taking over the business after he died.  Miryam works hard to make the store pay, both to support her mother who can no longer work and to share with her husband the family's other expenses.  Miryam and her husband have 2 children and she wants to provide for them in every way she can.  Miryam's mother owns the building where they operate the store, so she doesn't have any rent-related expenses.  Even so, there's never been any money to properly stock the store and it's barely scraping by.  Miryam is applying for a loan so that she can buy the merchandise she needs to grow the business.  She wants to stock the store with both the everyday products her customers need and with other products that the might want.  She expects the investment to bring in more customers and, in turn, increase her sales.  Miryam's goal for the future is to open a larger store.  She wants to increase her income and provide work for the people she would hire.  Her greatest hopes are that her mother enjoy good health and that her family have a steady income and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to stock her general store.

loans.name: Nestor Isaias

texts.es:
Nestor se ha dedicado desde muy joven a la actividad de la cerrajería, gracias a que su padre se dedicaba a esta actividad y le enseñó desde muy temprana edad. Nestor trabajó con su padre durante un tiempo y luego de que este murió quedó a cargo del negocio. Actualmente, Nestor se encuentra casado y es padre de 3 hijos, y gracias a su negocio de la cerrajería genera los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su familia. Nestor es reconocido en su sector por la trayectoria que tiene y por la buena calidad de sus productos, es por esto que tiene una clientela fija que le hace muy buenos pedidos. Nestor en la actualidad ha visto como su volumen de trabajo se ha incrementado considerablemente, hasta el punto en el que a veces no puede responder a todos los pedidos de sus clientes. Es por esto que Nestor busca comprar una máquina llamada compresor que le facilitará el trabajo y lo hará más eficiente. Sin embargo, Nestor no cuenta con el capital suficiente para la compra de esta máquina, por lo que aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de una máquina compresor que le permita elaborar sus productos en menor tiempo.

Nestor espera que de esta manera sus ingresos aumenten considerablemente, pues así podrá atender a clientes que antes debía rechazar. Nestor sueña con tener un gran taller y con poder generar empleo. Además sueña con que su familia pueda tener una mejor calidad de vida, que sus 3 hijos pueda acceder a una educación de calidad, y que puedan tener en el negocio una estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Ever since he was very young Nestor has devoted himself to the locksmith business.  This is thanks to the fact that his father did this, and his father taught Nestor at an early age.  Nestor worked with his father for a time, and then his father died.  Nestor was left with the business.

Nestor is now married and has three children.  Thanks to the locksmith business he generates the necessary income to support his family.  Nestor is known in his area for his experience and the good quality of his products.  That is why he has a fixed clientele, and they give him very good orders.

Currently Nestor has seen how his work volume has been increasing considerably.  It gets to a point that at times he is not able to respond to all of his customers’ orders.  That is why Nestor is looking to buy a machine called a compressor, which will make his work easier and more efficient.

However, Nestor does not have enough money to buy this machine.  That is why he hopes that a loan will give him the opportunity to buy the compressor, which will allow him to make his products in less time.

Nestor hopes that this way his income will increase considerably and that he will be able to take care of customers that he previously had to turn away.  Nestor dreams of having a big shop and of being able to generate employment.  He also dreams that his family will be able to have a better quality of life, his three children will be able to have a quality education, and that they can have financial stability in the business.

loans.use: to buy a compressor, which will allow him to make his products in less time.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more retail goods such as maize flour, rice, beans, cooking oil, etc., to resell.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es:
Rodrigo es una persona que se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajador y dedicado a su familia. Desde hace mucho tiempo inició trabajando como cotero (cargue y descargue de camiones) en su municipio, y gracias a esta actividad conoció un amigo productor de papa. Este le ofreció venderle papa para que él la comercializara en su municipio, y por esto, desde hace 2 años que Rodrigo combina su actividad de cotero con la comercialización de papa. Rodrigo vende su producto en su municipio a las principales tiendas del sector, y esto le ha permitido conocer un gran número de clientes que le hacen grandes pedidos. Debido a que en el momento tiene un gran pedido por parte de un cliente que no puede satisfacer con el inventario que tiene actualmente, Rodrigo debe comprar la papa para poderle entregar el pedido a este, sin embargo, Rodrigo no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta compra, por lo que aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de grandes cantidades de papa para poder abastecer el pedido que le ha hecho un cliente.	

Rodrigo espera poder seguir comercializando este producto y en un futuro poder diversificar los productos que ofrece. Es por esto que trabaja fuertemente todos los días y ha ahorrado poco a poco con el ánimo de montar una gran comercializadora de verduras y legumbres. Rodrigo sueña con que su esposa y sus 3 hijos tengan mayores oportunidades de progreso y puedan obtener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rodrigo is a person who is characterized by being very hard-working and dedicated to his family. A long time ago he began working as a laborer (loading and unloading trucks) in his town, and thanks to this work he met a friend who grows potatoes. The friend offered him the opportunity to sell potatoes, so that he could commercialize them in his town, and because of this, it has been two years since Rodrigo combined his work as a laborer with the sale of potatoes. Rodrigo sells his product in his town to the principal stores in the sector, and this has permitted him to meet a large number of customers who give him big orders. Because he now has a large order from one customer that he is unable to satisfy with the inventory that he now has, Rodrigo must buy the potatoes to be able to fill this order. Nevertheless, Rodrigo does not have sufficient capital to make this purchase, so he hopes that a loan will offer him the opportunity to make the purchase of large quantities of potatoes to be able to fill the order that one customer has placed with him.

Rodrigo hopes to be able to continue selling this product and in the future to be able to diversify the products that he offers. It is for this reason that he works hard every day and has saved little by little with the intention of setting up a large marketing operation for vegetables and fruits. Rodrigo dreams that his wife and his three children will have better opportunities to progress and can obtain a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of potatoes to be able to fill the order which a customer has placed.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius graduated from college with two degrees in Exercise Science and Sports Medicine. Since 2000, Julius has used both degrees to pursue a career in personal training. Two years ago he wanted to become more independent and opened "Amp Fitness" – a home-based business that specializes in physical health and helping individuals achieve their fitness goals. Julius currently has 14 clients and is working away, though he hopes to grow his business by expanding his online presence (www.ampfitness.webs.com) as well as his advertising scheme. He would like to employ additional trainers at Amp Fitness and eventually open his own gym. In addition, he is currently employed at Riviera Fitness as a personal trainer and has ranked number 1 in sales for the past 4 years. Julius is recently married and is in the process of moving out of his parents' house and in with his new wife. The purpose of this loan is to obtain a greater online presence by improving his website and advertising in the community.

loans.use: to update his online presence and advertising

loans.name: Maritza Del Transito

texts.es:
Maritza, es empleada de la alcaldía, vive con su madre, está soltera, ella tiene 5 años de tener una tienda de productos domésticos, sus padres se la heredaron, para que ella fuera la encargada.
Ella esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción porque quiere reparar el cuarto de su pertenencia, comprando arena y cemento, tambien ladrillo de piso, y otros materiales para el techo, con ello estará reparando el piso, el techo y las paredes, el propósito de ella es que por medio del préstamo pueda realizar la inversión.
La aspiración de Maritza es mejorar económicamente, apoyada de su madre y con el buen manejo de la tienda, su empleo y los prestamos.
Nota: a Maritza se le tomo la foto en las afueras de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Maritza is an employee in the mayor's office.  She is single, lives with her mother, and for past 5 years has had a domestics products store.  Her parents gave the store to her so that she could run it.

She is requesting a loan to buy construction materials because she wants to repair the room where she lives, buying sand and cement, bricks for the floor, and other materials for the roof.  With these supplies she will repair the floor, the roof and the walls.  Her aim is that through the loan she can carry out her investment.

Maritza's dream is to improve financially, supporting her mother, and with good management of the store, her work and the loans.

Note: Maritza's picture was taken outside her work.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, floor bricks and other materials for the roof

loans.name: Mariano Guadalupe

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “CUSI COYLLOR DE CHINCHERO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba  y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Mariano; el tiene 56 años de edad, soltero; el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes el vende diferentes tipos de productos como gaseosas, arroz, azucar, leche, golosinas entre otros, él socio lleva años en este negocio el cual mediante este el socio sale adelante, él socio trabaja todos los días desde las 06:00am hasta las 09:00pm aproximadamente, él socio es una persona bien responsable y con muchas ganas de continuar adelante.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería para su negocio como arroz, azucar, leche entre otros y de esta manera tener más variedad de productos que ofrecer a sus clientes.

El socio se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the community bank 'Cusi coyllor de Chinchero' in Chinchero, a district of the Urubamba province in the Cusco department.

Mariano is 56 years of age, single and alternates his daily tasks by attending to his grocery store, where he sells different types of products such as soft drinks, rice, sugar, milk and lollies, amongst others. He has worked in this business for years and it has helped him to keep going. He works every day from 6am until around 9pm. He is a very responsible person with a great will to get ahead. 

This member is asking for a loan to purchase groceries such as rice, sugar and milk, amongst others, so that he can have a greater variety of products to offer his customers. He promises to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to purchase groceries for his store such as rice, sugar and milk amongst other products

loans.name: Rafael Amilcar

texts.es:
Rafael, vive con su esposa y tiene cuatro hijos de 15, 12, 8 y 4 años de edad, él administra un negocio de hieleria, desde hace dos años, hasta la fecha este ha sido rentable, logrando cubrir todas las necesidades del hogar. 
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de un frisser, su intensión es tener más capacidad para almacenar hielo, por eso este préstamo será muy útil para sus mejoras y las del negocio.
El objetivo de Rafael es que por medio de los préstamos su negocio prospere, brindándole mayor seguridad y solvencia económica.
texts.en:
Rafael lives with his wife and has four children who are 15, 12, 8 and 4 years of age. He has run a freezer business for the last two years, which up until now has been very profitable and has allowed him to cover the essential household costs. 

Rafael is applying for a loan to purchase a freezer so that he can increase his ice storage capacity. This loan will be very useful, both to improve his business and to make his own improvements.

With this loan Rafael's goal is to make his business prosperous, giving him greater financial solvency and security.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer

loans.name: Djamaladdin

texts.ru:
Djamaladdin uje 4 qoda rabotayet taxistom. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti dlya pochinki taxi. On ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. Djamaladdin yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoim bratom.  Внутренне перемещённое лицо (ВПЛ) - человек, который был вынужден внезапно бежать из своего дома в результате вооружённого конфликта, насилия, нарушений прав человека, стихийных бедствий или других катастроф, но, в отличие от беженца, не перешел международную границу и находящийся на территории собственной страны (источник: Управления ООН по Координации Гуманитарных Вопросов).
Djamaladdin ochen trudolubiviy i dobriy chelovek vseqda pomogayet svoyey semye i bratu.
texts.en:
Djamaladdin has been working as a taxi driver for four years. At present he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy spare parts for repairing his taxi. He is single, without children. Djamaliddin is an IDP from the town of FUzuli, now living in the Region of Fuzuli together with his brother.

An internally displaced person (IDP) is someone who has been forced to flee his or her home due to armed conflict, violence, human rights violations, or natural or manmade disasters, but who, unlike a refugee, has not crossed an international border (source: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs).

Djamaladdin is a very hard-working and  kind person, and always helps out his family and his brother.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: La Sra. Rosario es cliente que vive en la zona de villa obraje, es soltera,  ella se dedica a  la venta de DVD hace mas de 3 años que se dedica al comercio y venta de DVD,  esta afiliada al sindicato de comerciantes minoristas realiza su venta todos los días  su puesto esta ubicado en un lugar estratégico y muy concurrido por lo que le va muy bien, el préstamo que solicito es para incrementar su mercadería, comprando películas infantiles y educativas, es una persona joven con ganas de superación esta es su única actividad con la que mantiene a su familia que esta compuesta  por sus padres y hermanos, ella desde muy temprano realiza su actividad se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución ya que le permite crecer en su negocio y con el tiempo mejorar sus calidad de vida y de toda su familia.
texts.en: Rosario is a customer who lives in Villa Obraje area. She buys and sells DVDs and has been doing this for more than 3 years. She is part of the retailers union. She sells her goods every day and her stall is in a strategic and busy location, and so things are going very well. She is requesting a loan to increase her stock by buying kids' movies and educational movies. She is a young person with a desire to excel. This is the only work she has for supporting her family, which consists of her parents and siblings. She carries out her business from very early. She feels happy and grateful to be part of the loan institution as it is helping her to grow her business and, with time, to improve the quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy children's and educational movies on DVD.

loans.name: Aubrey

texts.en:
Aubrey is a 24-year-old boda boda (motorcycle) operator in Mariakani. He is single. He has been operating this business for the last four years with success. 

This is Aubrey’s second business loan from KADET LTD . He plans to use it to purchase spare parts to repair his motorcycle. He will use the anticipated profits to improve his pig farming business. Aubrey hopes to have a more profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to repair his motorcycle

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel ha sido una persona que ha tenido que atravesar diferentes adversidades en su vida, sin embargo, las ganas de salir adelante le han permitido superarlas y continuar brindándole progreso a su familia. Manuel anteriormente trabajaba vendiendo frutas, pero esto no le daba los resultados que necesitaba, por lo que posteriormente pasó a un carrito de comidas rápidas donde vende fritos como papas, patacones, entre otros. Gracias a esta actividad, Manuel ha podido sacar adelante a su esposa y sus 4 hijos, a tal punto que 2 de ellos ya pueden acceder a la educación universitaria. Manuel trabaja a las afueras de un colegio, lo que le permite tener gran cantidad de clientes. Actualmente a Manuel no le alcanza con su carrito de comidas para preparar los fritos que piden sus clientes, por lo que busca la compra de un segundo carrito de fritos y poder así ofrecer la variedad que ellos buscan. Sin embargo, Manuel no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta compra, por lo que aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de un carrito de comidas y tener así donde preparar una mayor variedad de sus fritos.

Manuel espera que su negocio siga creciendo y de esta manera pueda generar mayores ingresos para su familia. Además, sueña con tener un gran puesto de comidas en el cual pueda generar empleo para las personas que más lo necesitan y poder brindarles así una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Manuel has had to face many adversities in his life, however his will to get ahead has allowed him to overcome them and continue to raise his family. Manuel used to sell fruit, however this did not get the results he needed so he began selling fried food from a cart, such as potato chips and 'patacon' (fried flattened plantains), amongst others. Thanks to this work, Manuel has been able to support his wife and their four children to the extent that two of their children can now enter university. Manuel works outside a college, which means he can sell to a large number of customers. 

At the moment Manuel's fast food cart cannot keep up with the demand of his customers, which is why he is hoping to purchase a second fast food cart to offer his customers the variety of foods they are asking for. However, Manuel does not have enough capital to make this purchase, which is why he hopes to gain a loan which will give him the opportunity to purchase another cart and have somewhere to prepare a wider variety of fried food.  

Manuel hopes that his business will continue to grow so that he will be able to generate a higher income for his family. As well as this, he dreams of having a large food stall where he could provide employment for those who need it and in this way give them a better quality of life and financial stability for their children.

loans.use: to purchase a food cart to have somewhere to prepare a wider variety of fried food

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana  has been a baker for a number of years. She bakes  bread and  meat pies in Ampayin. Nana  has 2 children and uses her income to feed and clothe  them. She will use her loan to purchase flour, sugar and oil for her bakery.. She hopes to use the new profits  to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar and oil

loans.name: La Cantera  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como El Cady en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las 15 socias y los 2 socios  del Banco Comunal La Cantera. Los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como la agricultura y al comercio en general. Los mismos que unieron sus esfuerzos para poder acceder a los beneficios que presta la Fundación Espoir, este es su segundo  crédito y esperan seguir por mucho tiempo en el Banco Comunal.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Marcia, tiene 19 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y aun no tienen  hijos. El marido  se dedica al comercio. Ella estudia el tercer semestre de Administración de Empresas en una universidad de la localidad.

Es una joven ama de casa que además de estudiar para un futuro mejor también se dedica a la venta de productos Avon  (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días ya que además de vender por su localidad también vende en la universidad donde estudia, este crédito lo quiere invertir en ropa y zapatillas de temporada, espera vender estos nuevos productos al mismo tiempo que realiza sus otras ventas. Tiene un año que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
	
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, trajes de baño, bermudas, camisetas y zapatillas. Este es el segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal, es la presidenta del banco y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que alquila donde vive.

Los dos niños de la foto son hijos de dos socias.
texts.en:
In the sector known as El Cady in the Colon church of the city of Portoviejo, 15 female members and 2 male members of the community bank La Cantera get together every 15 days.  They work on different activities such as agriculture and commerce in general.  The same members that joined forces to have access to the benefits of Fundacion Espoir are working for their second loan and hope to be part of the community bank for a long time.

One of the members is Marcia, she is 19, she is in a common law relationship and has no children.  Her partner works in commerce, she studies the 3rd semester of business administration at the local university.

She is a young housewife that in addition to studying for a better future also sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, accessories).  She works hard every day and in addition to selling in her town, she also sells at the university where is studies, the loan will be used to invest in seasonal clothing and shoes, that she hopes to promote and sell while sells her avon products.  She has done this activity for a year and she is doing very well.

This loan will be used to buy clothing, swimwear, shorts, t-shirts and shoes.  This is the second loan with the community bank, she is the president of the bank and likes being a member because the repayments can be easily made.

Her dream is to own a house because she rents where she lives.

The two kids in the picture are the children of the members.

loans.use: To buy clothing, swimwear, shorts, t-shirts and shoes.

loans.name: Ziyafaddin

texts.ru: Ziyafaddin yavlyayetsya IDP personom ( Внутренне перемещённое лицо (ВПЛ) - человек, который был вынужден внезапно бежать из своего дома в результате вооружённого конфликта, насилия, нарушений прав человека, стихийных бедствий или других катастроф, но, в отличие от беженца, не перешел международную границу и находящийся на территории собственной страны (источник: Управления ООН по Координации Гуманитарных Вопросов))on pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Ziyafaddin jenat, u nego 3 rebonka. On ochen lubit svoyu semyu i delayet vse vozmojnoye dlya ix schastya. Etomu molodomu cheloveku 36 let. On uje 7 let kak imeyet svoy magazin. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit nujniye produkti dlya pereprodaji, v osobennosti te produkti k kotorim imeyetsya bolshe sprosa sredi kliyentov.
texts.en:
Ziyafaddin is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  This is someone who has been forced to leave their home suddenly as a result of armed conflict, violence, human rights violations, natural disasters or other catastrophes, but unlike a refugee, has not crossed an international border and remains within their country's borders. (Source:  U.N. Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs.)  

Ziyafaddin migrated from the city of Fuzuli to a rural part of the Fuzuli region where he now lives with his family.  Ziyafaddin is married and has three young children.  He loves his family very much and he does everything possible for their happiness. He's a young man at 36 years old and he has already had his own store for seven years. Now he needs 2000 AZN to buy grocery goods, especially those that are most in demand by his customers.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for resale

loans.name: Ingrid Guadalupe

texts.es:
Ingrid, es comerciante de ropa, vive con su madre, la casa es familiar, tiene un hijo de un año de edad, ella tiene ya dos años en el negocio de la ropa, lo heredo de su madre, logrando hasta el momento obtener ingresos para los gastos de la casa.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería, ya que quiere surtir el negocio con variedad de colores y estilos en blusas, faldas, ropa interior, short, para mantenerse competente y con más oportunidades de crecer.
El objetivo de Ingrid mejorar económicamente con su familia, espera lograrlo a través del financiamiento de los prestamos.
texts.en:
Ingrid is a merchant who sells clothing.  She lives with her mother in the family home, and she has a one year-old child.  She has already been selling clothing for 2 years. This is a business that was passed down to her from her mother, and up until now she has managed to generate income with it to support the household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise, since she wants to stock up her business with a variety of colors and styles of blouses, skirts, underwear and shorts.  This will keep her business up-to-date, and give her more opportunities to grow.  Ingrid's goal is to improve the economic status of her family through these loans.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, underwear and shorts

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Originally from Cuba, Eduardo moved to Miami, Florida, and now works for a large importing/exporting technology company by the name of "Global Galan Logistics". He has been employed with this company for over three years and has gained a wealth of experience. With this experience, Eduardo started his own importing/exporting business, "Goldie Eddy Trading Corp.", over seven months ago and has seen steady growth ever since. His company is focused on the exportation of computer parts, cell phones, and other electronics to Latin American countries. 

Now, Eduardo would like to expand his business, taking it to the next level, by purchasing a greater bulk of inventory for re-sale. Eduardo is the only person employed with his company now, but he hopes that with continual, manageable growth he will be able to hire employees soon. Eduardo is married and lives with his wife in Miami. The purpose of this loan will be to purchase a bulk of inventory for resale.

loans.use: to purchase bulk inventory for resale

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans Karani is a 42 year-old photographer in Mariakani. He is a divorced father of two.  He has been running this business for the past three years successfully.

This marks his second business loan from Kiva partner KADET LTD . He plans to purchase new cameras, camera batteries and a printer. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children. He hopes to grow his business to be bigger and more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase new cameras, camera batteries and a printer.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 37 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Convive con Leni quien es mototaxista, fruto de esa unión tienen 03 hijos de 19, 22 y 10 años de edad, habitando su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Ana es la costura y confección de lencerías para damas y caballeros para eso cuenta con un taller que instaló en su propia casa, iniciándose con una maquina de coser que compró con sus ahorros hace 04 meses, contando con el apoyo de su hija mayor en la costura en sus ratos libres. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite contar con un ingreso económico para pagarse sus gastos, dicho negocio lo aprendió en un centro de educación ocupacional propiciada por una monjas de un iglesia, quienes daban clases de manera gratuita, así se hizo de un oficio para tener un ocupación. Ahora viendo que le resulta rentable tiene planes de hacer crecer su negocio y ampliar con más maquinas. Este será el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Además de estar cómoda con su grupo solidario pues lo considera un grupo responsable y unido. Con el monto solicitado de 2500 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para la costura como telas, hilos, elásticos para tener stock disponible en su almacén de materiales.
texts.en:
Ana is 37 and a hard-working, determined woman, who is very eager to get ahead. She lives with Leni, who is a mototaxi operator. They have three children, ages 22, 19, and 10, and live in their own house. 

Ana is a dressmaker and makes women's and men's lingerie. For this she has a workshop that she set up in her own home, starting out with a sewing machine that she bought with her savings four months ago, and relying on the help with the sewing that her older sister provides in her spare time. 

She likes her business, as it allows her to have an income to pay her expenses. She learned this business at a vocational training center, started by the nuns of a church, who gave free classes. So she learned a trade in order to have an occupation. Now, seeing that her business turns out to be profitable, she has plans to make it grow, and expand with more machines. 

This will be her second loan with MFP, so she is hoping for a small loan so that she can meet her objectives. In addition, she is comfortable with her solidarity group, as she considers it close-knit and responsible. With the amount of 2,500 nuevos soles applied for, she will buy sewing materials such as fabric, thread, and elastic, in order to have stock available in her materials storeroom.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread and elastic.

loans.name: Chela Luz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AHORRO ES PROGRESO-SAYLLA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Saylla, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Chela Luz; ella tiene 29 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de chicharroneria, ella vende chicharrones que es un plato a base de carne de chancho con papas fritas, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de chicharroneria. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como carne de chancho y papas al por mayor.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member is a part of the communal bank, " Ahorro es Progresso-Saylla" ( Saving is Progress-Saylla); the bank is located in the district of Saylla, which pertains to the Cusco province.

Her name is Chela Luz, she is 29 years old, married and has 2 kids.  She alternates her daily activities between selling a plate based on pork grinds served with fried potato slices and she works from 8AM to 6PM. Through this business she is able to get her kids ahead and her dream is to be able to expand her business.  She solicits the loan to purchase cooking ingredients such as pork and potatoes in bulk.
This member is happy with her loan and commits herself to pay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to purchase cooking materials such as: pork and potatoes in bulk.

loans.name: Karyn

texts.en: Karyn is a resident of Newport, Rhode Island, and owns Sacred Stone, which specializes in massage therapy, yoga and ayurveda treatments, home-study training and short-term workshops, and holistic product sales. Previously the business operated out of her home, but due to lack of space for accommodating larger groups, she decided to open a new location. In January, she moved to a larger location and developed a sister school, NAMTA (Newport Academy of Massage Therapy and Ayurveda), as a qualification program designed to prepare students for the National Certification Board of Therapeutic Message and Bodywork. This expansion has allowed Karyn to reformat her program, making it longer and more inclusive. NAMTA has also enabled her to seek employees. She has already received over 30 inquires. Karyn will use this loan to purchase massage tables, small equipment and other necessary facilities to better accommodate her students.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to make a student-friendly studio

loans.name: Priscillar

texts.en: Priscillar is 53 years old and married.  She has owned and operated a cereals shop in Voi for the past five years with great success. This marks Priscillar's fourth business loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use it to purchase more maize, beans, peas and green grams (mung beans) for sale. Priscillar will use the anticipated profits to open other business outlets. She hopes to have a bigger, more profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase more maize, beans, peas and green grams.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa is a fish monger at Ampanyi near Elmina.  She buys fresh fish from the market, smokes it and sells it.  She has been in this business for some years now.  Yaa  is marrried to a fisherman and has three children. Yaa assists her husband to feed and clothe their children. Yaa will use her loan to purchase more fresh fish which she will smoke and then sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish which she will smoke and sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 46 years-old, married to Pamela and together they are blessed with children which are school going.

He has a retail shop in the area of Mathare where he sells things like sugar, flour and cooking oil. He has been in this business for the last two years and gets an income of KES.10,000 per month.

He has got good credit history with Kiva partner KADET  LTD and he is applying for his second loan of KES.40,000.  He plans to use this loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour and cooking oil.  He will use the anticipated profit to educate his children.

He hopes to venture into the real estate business.

loans.use: to buy more stock such as sugar, flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bags of maize to prepare her porridge to sell.

loans.name: Annastasia

texts.en:
Annastasia is 36 years-old and practices mixed crop farming.  She is married to Michael who is a businessman. They are blessed with three children aged 19, 16 and 14 years respectively.
