She says she will buy more poultry birds to improve her income from her poultry business and provide her family's basic needs. She remains optimistic with business growth saying her life has improved since she started active farming and emphasizes poultry business is more lucrative with a ready market.

She is grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for the loan facility.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Thoem

texts.en:
Mrs. Thoem is 25 years old and married with two single children attending a local school. Her husband helps share his income for the family by working as a construction worker from place to place around the country. She presently works in a garment factory and gets her payment monthly. 

With the loan she has requested from HKL, Thoem will buy construction supplies to support her husband’s business. She hopes that her living conditions will improve through using Kiva’s funds. She is very thankful to our lenders.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to support her husband’s business.

loans.name: Elguja

texts.en:
Elguja is 48 years old. He is married and lives in the village of Skhvilisi, South Georgia with his wife Manana. The only source of income for the family is agriculture. They own 1.3 hectare of land where they grow potatoes and cabbage. Elguja sells harvested products on the local open market. Also, the family has a milk cow. Manana produces and sells on average 15 kg of cheese per month. The total average monthly income of the family is 400 Laris. 

Elguja requested a loan for purchasing potatoes for sowing. Once he purchases quality seeds, he can count on a good harvest for the summer, which can be sold for a good price. The family will save the income from the sales and use it during the year for financing their daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes for sowing

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 28 years old and married to Pacifica. They are blessed with one child who is three years old and support two other members of his family.  He is a farmer in Irimis practicing passion fruit farming and has been in operation for a period of two years, earning a monthly income of KES 8,000.

He has joined KADET LTD and now is taking his first loan of KES 20,000 and wishes to use this amount to purchase seedlings, a knapsack sprayer, fertilizers and herbicides. 

The profits will be used to start a computer lab business offering internet services as well as photocopying. His dream is to become self sustainable and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 38 years old and lives in the town of Bunghoko in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has six children with five of them currently in school. For the past five years, Joseph has been working hard to manage his small shop, which sells clothes. 

To help expand his business, Joseph has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale and will help Joseph to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Joseph hopes that in the future, he will be able to expand his business. 

Joseph is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Joseph who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 27 years old. She is married to Julius, and they are blessed with three children. She is hawker of clothes in the area of Pangani, Nairobi. She has been in this business for the last four years and gets an income of 7,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) per month.

Florence has a good credit history in KADET, whereby she is applying for her third loan of KES 80,000. She plans to purchase clothes and weaves used in salons. She will use the anticipated profit to increase the stock in her business and improve her standard of living.

She hopes to open a salon college to teach many people so that they may help themselves. She is very hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase stock of clothes for sale.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is from the village of Minadze, South Georgia. He is 59 years old, married and lives with his wife Mariam. Production of dairy products is the main source of the income for the family. George has milk cows. In addition, he purchases milk from neighbor farmers and uses it for cheese production. George sells harvested products on the local open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 640 Laris. 

George requested a loan to start a new business initiative. He will purchase calves and feed them during the winter months. In late spring, George will sell grown calves and get additional income. The family will be able to purchase needed household goods and spend more on their daily needs in order to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy retail stock like sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Wilian Alexander

texts.es:
El señor Wilian tiene 38 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida y dos hijos.

Él se dedica a trabajar en la crianza de pollos desde hace 10 años, empezó ayudándole a un vecino que realizaba esta actividad, luego el vecino le dio al crédito 50 pollos para que los engordara y los vendiera en libras. Después él junto con su mamá compraron más de 100 pollos, los destazaron y los comercializaron.

Actualmente Wilian esta criando pollos cada seis semanas, que son los días de producción, él vende ya libreado 500 libras, él tiene su clientela entre ellos abastece a un hotel y tiendas en varias comunidades. Él compra 110 pollos en una ciudad que esta a 56 kilómetros de donde él vive y logra sacar 100 pollos de 5 libras cada uno. Para comprar los pollos debe salir de su casa a las 6:00 a.m. camina tres kilómetros y medio, luego aborda un vehiculo que lo conduce a la ciudad que es donde compra los pollos. Estos los compra una vez a la semana y también el concentrado para alimentar a sus pollos.

Cuando es temporada agrícola Wilian se dedica a sembrar granos básicos para la venta y también trabaja como ayudante de un albañil.

El señor Wilian solicita el préstamo a Fundación Campo para comprar 125  pollos más, concentrado para alimentar a los que ya tiene y a los que comprara, ya que la demanda esta creciendo, una vez alcanzan su peso los destaza, los limpia y los vende en libras. También ampliara la granja por lo menos para unos 50 pollos más. De esta manera recibirá mayores ingresos, por que abastecerá a todos sus clientes y cubrirá la demanda, con esos ingresos proporcionara a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

Él piensa trabajar muy duro en la crianza de pollos y solo dedicarse a eso, ya que es la actividad que más ingresos recibe, también desea construir su propia casa ya que vive en casa de su mamá, el terreno ya lo tiene solo falta construir.
texts.en:
Wilian is 38 years old and lives with his life partner and two children.  He has worked raising chickens for ten years.  He began helping a neighbor who was doing this work.  Then his neighbor gave him 50 chickens on credit so he could fatten them and sell them by the pound.  Later he got together with his mother and they bought more than 100 chickens, quartered them, and sold them.

Currently Wilian is raising chickens every six weeks, which are the days of production.  He sells 500 pounds already delivered.  He has his customers, among whom he supplies a hotel and stores in various communities.  He buys 110 chickens in a city that is 56 miles from where he lives, and manages to get 100 five-pound chickens.  To buy the chickens he has to leave the house at 6:00 a.m., walk three-and-a-half kilometers, and board a vehicle that drives him to the city where he buys the chickens.  He buys them once a week along with the feed to feed them.  During farming season Wilian works growing basic grains to sell and also works as the assistant of a bricklayer.

Wilian is requesting the loan from Fundación Campo to buy 125 more chickens and feed to feed those he already has and those he will buy, because the demand is growing.  Once they reach their weight he quarters them, cleans them, and sells them by the pound.  He also will expand the farm for at least 50 more chickens.  In this way he will receive greater income, because he will supply all his customers and meet the demand.  With this income he will give his family a better quality of life.

He plans to work very hard raising the chickens and work only on this, since this is the work from which he gets the most income.  He also wants to construct his own house because he lives in his mother's house.  He already has the plot of land; he only needs to build.

loans.use: to buy 125 more chickens and feed to feed them, and to expand the farm.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Juan tiene 32 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene tres hijos, uno de 10 años de edad que esta por comenzar a estudiar quinto grado, una hija de 7 años de edad que comenzara a estudiar primer grado y el más pequeño de sus hijos que tiene 7 meses. Viven en la casa que su suegra les dejo, la esposa de Juan elabora pequeñas ventas de productos en su casa, como: enchiladas y enrredos. El señor Juan es agricultor, pero por el momento esta trabajando como albañil.

El comenta que es agricultor, por que siempre le ha gustado, pero se dio cuenta que le generaba mejores ingresos y más rápido la albañilería. Por lo que comenzó a aprender desde la edad de 12 años de edad, su papá fue quien le enseño este oficio. Ahora con 32 años de edad, dice que le gusta más el oficio de albañil y así puede trabajar con sus hermanos y su papá.

Al principio todo trabajo lo realizaba con la ayuda de su padre, pues era él quien andaba las herramientas, con el paso del tiempo Juan ahorro dinero y fue comprando sus materiales, herramientas y equipo de trabajo, por eso ya no depende tanto de su padre y realiza trabajos de manera independiente, pero comento que siempre es mejor trabajar en familia.

El préstamo que solicita a Fundación Campo, es para cancelar una deuda que tiene y para que sus dos hijos mayores puedan iniciar sus clases sin ningún problema. Él piensa continuar trabajando con ánimos, por su familia, comento que todo padre responsable esta obligado a trabajar por sus hijos, además quiere que en un futuro su hijo mayor aprenda el oficio de su padre así como él aprendió el suyo.
texts.en:
Juan is 32, lives with his partner, and has three children. One is 10 years old and about to start fifth grade; a 7-year-old daughter will start first grade. The smallest of his children is 7 months old. They live in the house his mother-in-law left them. Juan's wife has a small business in their home selling enchiladas and enredos (snack food made from fried yuca).

Juan is a farmer, but at the present time he is working in construction. He says that he farms because he has always liked it. But he realized that he earned more income, more quickly, doing construction. 

So he started to learn from the age of 12. His father taught him this trade. Now 32, he says he likes the construction trade better, and in this way he can work with his siblings and his father. In the beginning, he did every job with his father's help, as he was the one who had the tools. 

As time went on, Juan saved money and started buying his materials, tools, and work equipment. That's why he no longer depends so much on his father, and does jobs independently. But he says it is always better to work as a family. 

He is applying to Fundación Campo for a loan, in order to pay off a debt that he has, and so that his elder children can start classes without any problem. He plans to continue working energetically for his family. He says that every responsible father is obliged to work for his children. In addition, someday he wants his eldest son to learn his father's trade, just as he learned it from his.

loans.use: To pay off a debt he has, and so that his two older children can start their classes without any problem.
